title: secure connection could not be established. This issue is caused by Sample CA 2
content:
When try to bring up NortonSafe Search I get this error:

search.norton.com is most likely a safe site, but a secure connection could not be established. This issue is caused by Sample CA 2, which is either software on your computer or your network.

When I try to connect to www.google.com I get this error:

www.google.com is most likely a safe site, but a secure connection could not be established. This issue is caused by Sample CA 2, which is either software on your computer or your network.

When I try to connect to support.mozilla.org

support.mozilla.org is most likely a safe site, but a secure connection could not be established. This issue is caused by Sample CA 2, which is either software on your computer or your network.

I can connect to all three of these on Chrome and Edge browsers.

I have the latest version (Chrome is up to date Version 105.0.5195.102 (Official Build) (64-bit).

Why does this error only happen on Firefox?

title: Full screen shows bands on top and left, first time, but doesn't do it in private window or second time
content:
When I first use full-screen mode with Firefox, small bands appear on the top and left sides of the full-screen window. The second time I use it, it appears normally.

I have tried a fresh profile, it doesn't happen in a fresh profile. I have tried in safe-mode, doesn't happen in safe-mode. I have tried turning off all extensions, it still happens.

When I run in a private window, it doesn't happen either.

Any idea what's happening in safe-mode and a private window that fixes the problem.

It's really just an annoyance, but I'd like to nail this bizarre behavior down and fix it.

Any ideas? Thanks.
creator: rjhansen075

title: Printing from Website, Images are magnified and cutoff, Text is okay
content: Trying to print from a County Property Record that has a mixture of text and images (such as floor plan's, house pictures, etc). The print preview shows correctly. All images are full view and to scale, text is clear and to scale. The paper printout however has all of the Images magnified and only part of the Image is showing within the image frame. All text prints fine. I can print to a pdf and all is good matching the print preview. I can then print from the pdf and all is still good on paper. The Problem is only when printing directly from the website print preview to paper. I do not have any problems printing the same website from Safari or Chrome. I have tried from my home network, my Mac to my Brother printer. Then from a friends home network, their Mac to their Brother and HP printers and the issue is the same. Definitely not a hardware issue and same symptoms on different instances of Firefox. My workaround is to first print to pdf and then print the pdf to paper but would prefer a direct solution. Appreciate any help in resolving!
creator: bjennings21

title: This connection is not secure Warning
content:
For a long time, I have been able to turn off the Firefox security warning message that says This connection is not secure by going into the about:config settings and changing security.insecure_field_warning.contextual.enabled to false. Ever since Firefox version 104.0, this setting no longer has any effect, the warning now shows up. This is really annoying because the site we are going to is an internal Intranet site (web application) that resolves internally, it does not go through our firewall. I helped write the web application. I know there is not a realistic risk issue here.

Does anyone know how I can get this warning turned back off for my users?

title: Print popup window ghosted except for Format field
content:
I'm on FF Beta v105.0b6, and a recent upgrade (I'm guessing from 104 to 105) has caused popup windows to be ghosted when saving files, leaving only the file selector field visible and floating above the main window, often indistinguishable from the text below it. I've been able to work around this by temporarily jumping to another screen or window and then back to find the complete popup window magically revealed.

I've attached two clips from windows a see after clicking Download link on the https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/new/ page. This ghost behavior also happens on pages where I right-click context to "save as" or click download link for TXT, PDF, PKG or other types of files.

This doesn't seem to be a popup blocking issue, since my FF is not configured to block these specific sites and the popup is minimally visible. Also, the temporary workaround of simply switching my view away and back points more to a page rendering issue.

I'd appreciate any ideas on resolving or preventing this behavior. If these clues point to a bug, I hope they help resolve the issue.

Thanks for any suggestions!
creator: karbrozone-fox

title: Failed Update ... What next?
content:
My wife has an older Mac. About a week ago, a pop-up from Firefox told her to update her program. She loaded in the new one and when she tried to open it she got the message that her computer was too old for the update.

We had to reload the most recent update which had been running on her computer.

Now, none of her bookmarks show up and the bookmark toolbar will not display near the top of the screen as it used to.

None of help items online are of any use because what they say will show up on the screen (such as when you enter "about:profiles") is not what shows up on her screen.

Is there any way to recover her bookmarks, passwords and other saved data, please?

title: Fonts are sometimes rendered too thin
content:
For the past 5 or 6 major versions of Firefox, in some websites, sometimes the fonts used are rendered too thin, making it difficult to read. It's inconsistent though, it affects some websites but others not, a website may be affected today but not tomorrow, hitting ctrl+f5 several times or closing and reopening the browser a couple times, sometimes fix it, sometimes not.

Looking at the font inspector, I couldn't find a specific font family that causes it, seems to be random too. Font settings are at the default. The source of the font file seems not to matter as well, it can be Google fonts, local fonts, the website server itself, even when developing locally... it's the same.

Now in Firefox 103 none of the "tricks" I mentioned before are capable of fixing the problem when it happens to a particular website. I've seen a lot of questions in this forum about the same problem but nothing helps.

In the attached screenshots you can see the difference between how it looks with and without the issue.
creator: faelv

creator: clarastrano

title: Firefox won't open attachment/finder windows
content:
For approximately 8 months now, I have issues where - on occasion - Firefox will not open the attachment or finder window on my browser when prompted to by clicking the appropriate button on a website.

For instance, if I am in my gmail, and want to attach a file to an email, I will click the paperclip button. Normally, a tiny finder/browser window would open where I select the file and attach it. That will not occur. No window comes up for me to do that until I close Firefox completely and restart it.

Similarly, if I were on Facebook and wanted to upload a picture to my feed, I would click 'post' followed by 'add photo/video.' Normally at this time a window would pop up for me to select something from my computer, but nay, Firefox will not do so unless I completely shut down the program and restart it.

Once I restart it, either by closing all of my tabs and closing the program completely (using latest Mac OS), or 'force quitting' Firefox, the programs work find and selection windows appear.

That said, it's incredibly frustrating when you're working on something or have a bunch of tabs open for whatever reason.

I have made sure that my OS and Firefox are both up to date. It doesn't stop the problem. The only help files I've found suggest this is a recurring problem that bug fixes have been put out in the past, but can't find a permanent solution.

Please help!
creator: bkulbacki

title: Do Cookies Move Along with the 'Open in New Container Tab'
content:
Good day,

Started playing with the 'Container Tabs' add-on in Firefox. I noticed that there are instances that when a website opens up in Firefox, it may open up in a 'general' tab that has not been assigned a container. Let's say that this website installs cookies, will they be carried on into the new container when right clicking the tab to choose 'Open in New Container Tab'?

My concern is that one would otherwise create a pool of cookies that are not carried along into the new container(s), and that are potentially accessible by cross-site tracking cookies that made or make their way into that same pool.

Looking forward to insights!
creator: AmsterDan
